title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1242.27 - Berth usage; mooring and cargo handling tackle and labor
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1242.27 - Berth usage; mooring and cargo handling tackle and labor

State Regulations

Each permittee shall, at his own cost and expense, keep
clean the premises covered by his permit, and provide all tackle, gear and
labor for the docking or mooring of such watercraft at a terminal, and shall
also provide at his own cost and expense, such appliances and employ such
persons as he may require for the loading and unloading of passengers and
cargo. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1242.27

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
